Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was missing a vision and hearing test upon admission.
Correction Narrative: Email received stating moving forward to correct issue with vision and hearing requirements/screenings will either be checked in the three-day visit or by the nurse within the prescribed time frame set by minimum standards.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care did not have a dental appointment with 90 days of admission.
Correction Narrative: Email received stated when children arrive at operation, they have established a secondary dental provider to help meet timeframes that are required by minimum standard requirements.  At the time of the appointment the dental availability was outside of the 90-day requirements of minimum standards.

Deficiency Narrative: A child refused to take medication, this refusal or the reason of refusal was not documented on the medication record.
Correction Narrative: Email received stated when children refuse medications, not only will there be documented as a serious incident report in the childÂ’s record, the refusal will also be indication on the med log sheet for each refusal. This deficiency was corrected on 12/5/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: Two child medication records had a space for prohibited prescription or allergies to medication however this was left blank.
Correction Narrative: Email received stated Med Log records were completed leaving no blank spaces on the records, i.e. any medication allergies.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing medication logs the reason why the medication is being prescribed was not listed for two child files.
Correction Narrative: Email received stated med Log records were completed leaving no blank spaces on the records, i.e. the reasons for the medications.

Deficiency Narrative: Child orientation was not in two child files. Operation stated topics are discussed when admitting the children, but it has not been document.
Correction Narrative: Email received stated For all current residents an orientation was completed with new sign-in sheets, with resident signatures.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing background checks there were three employees who are not long employed since mid-November, with active background checks.
Correction Narrative: Email received stated upon termination of employment, Human Resources will inactivate the employees in the DFPS Provider Portal, within three (3) business days. On this specific deficiency, this was remedied on 12/4/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: When reviewing two child's records the known contraindications to the use of restraint was not addressed.
Correction Narrative: Email received stating in all child records an addendum was created to specifically list any known contraindications to the use of restraint. Moving forward, this will be included in both the Preliminary Service Plan, the Initial Service Plan, and the Admissions Assessment.

Deficiency Narrative: Video reviewed showed staff pouring a cup of ice on child's head.
Correction Narrative: Staff interviewed confirmed management regularly discuss discipline. Staff were also provided SAMA refresher. Sign in sheets were provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Interviews reported hearing the staff curse at a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Staff interviewed confirmed management regularly discuss discipline. Staff were also provided SAMA refresher. Sign in sheets were provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Video reviewed and staff interviews confirm that staff engaged in a physical altercation with a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Staff interviewed confirmed management regularly discuss discipline. Staff were also provided SAMA refresher. Sign in sheets were provided.

Deficiency Narrative: This standard was found deficient as part of a DFPS Investigation
Correction Narrative: Staff interviewed confirmed management regularly discuss discipline and child's rights. Staff were also provided SAMA refresher. Sign in sheets were provided.

Deficiency Narrative: An employee engaged in a power struggle with a child in care while matching their energy and escalating the situation further.
Correction Narrative: Administrator emailed compliance plan to RCCR inspector on 6/27/24. Prior to this investigation the staff in question was coached on engaging in power struggles with residents. The staff will receive training on Stress Management and Preventing Burnout. They will be required to check in with supervisors every shift and will tap out when they, themselves are escalated. Document was uploaded to document library.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's service plan did not have the required amount of team members/professionals present.
Correction Narrative: RCCR Supervisor interviewed Administrator at Blue Skies on 5-14-2024, inspection #4001808. They stated they are working on service plans and making them more detailed and to fit the child's needs. They met with the new case manager to go over what changes need to be made.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's service plan does not include personal or specific strategies to meet the child's behavioral, supervision, and high-risk needs.
Correction Narrative: RCCR Supervisor interviewed Administrator at Blue Skies on 5-14-2024, inspection #4001808. They stated they are working on service plans and making them more detailed and to fit the child's needs. They met with the new case manager to go over what changes need to be made.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member was observed on video saying they will restrain a child and make them feel the ground.
Correction Narrative: RCCR Supervisor completed a follow up inspection #4001808, on 5-14-2024. 2 children were interviewed along with 1 staff member about EBI and discipline. The children stated that staff hasn't been restraining the children as much. They stated they only get restrained if they are trying to hurt themselves or someone else. The staff member stated they have been retrained and get refreshers often. They feel it has been helping and have seen a decrease in restraints. The administrator was interviewed and stated the EBI numbers have decrease significantly since they have retrained staff. Regarding the staff in the allegations, they were written up for the comments. They stated they have seen a difference in the behavior of the staff, and they have no issues since.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member was observed on video telling a child that "we need to get you out of here."
Correction Narrative: RCCR Supervisor completed a follow up inspection #4001808, on 5-14-2024. 2 children were interviewed along with 1 staff member about EBI and discipline. The children stated that staff hasn't been restraining the children as much. They stated they only get restrained if they are trying to hurt themselves or someone else. The staff member stated they have been retrained and get refreshers often. They feel it has been helping and have seen a decrease in restraints. The administrator was interviewed and stated the EBI numbers have decrease significantly since they have retrained staff. Regarding the staff in the allegations, they were written up for the comments. They stated they have seen a difference in the behavior of the staff, and they have no issues since.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member hit a child in the face as a means to get the child to comply.
Correction Narrative: The staff were interviewed and they stated they were retrained for EBI and are doing training this week with de-escalation. They have seen a big decrease in restraints.

Deficiency Narrative: Children confirmed during interviews that they observed the staff restrain the child.
Correction Narrative: The staff were interviewed and they stated they were retrained for EBI and are doing training this week with de-escalation. They have seen a big decrease in restraints.

Deficiency Narrative: During the interviews staff confirmed statements were made indicating the child needed to comply and learn to behave as they continued with a restraint.
Correction Narrative: The staff were interviewed and they stated they were retrained for EBI and are doing training this week with de-escalation. They have seen a big decrease in restraints. .

Deficiency Narrative: Staff did not release the child from the restraint after the child said they could not breathe. Collateral staff confirmed during interviews that the staff member was directed to release the child from the restraint and the child said they could not breathe.
Correction Narrative: The staff were interviewed and they stated they were retrained for EBI and are doing training this week with de-escalation. They have seen a big decrease in restraints.

Deficiency Narrative: A restraint was implemented after the child was walking away from the situation. The child was not a danger to themselves or others at the time.
Correction Narrative: The staff were interviewed and they stated they were retrained for EBI and are doing training this week with de-escalation. They have seen a big decrease in restraints.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was hit in the face by operation staff.
Correction Narrative: The staff member was fired.

Deficiency Narrative: Video showed staff did not attempt a less restrictive intervention prior to initiating a containment on a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Interviewed 2 staff member and they talked about being retrained in EBI last week. The staff EBI training certificate were reviewed.

Deficiency Narrative: Interviews confirmed staff did not keep the children in line of sight while the children played in the fort.
Correction Narrative: Case manager reported all staff are informed of the supervision. A follow up inspection was conducted, and case manager reported all staff are informed of the supervision. Staff interviewed stated their lead supervisor goes over supervision during shift change if it has changed for the child or they have a new child.

Deficiency Narrative: This standard was found deficient as part of a DFPS Investigation
Correction Narrative: Staff were retrained on EBI procedures and policies. The action taken by this particular staff was not condoned nor tolerated by Blue Skies. He was placed on administrative leave and then terminated before the conclusion of this investigation.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member placed a child's arm behind their back during a restraint.
Correction Narrative: After reviewing this event, Blue Skies immediately notified DFPS Hotline as this event was not permitted in Blue Skies Procedure. The staff performed a restraint that was not trained on nor permitted by Blue Skies procedure. The staff member was terminated, and retraining took place for all other staff, beginning on April 12th.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff interviewed during the investigation confirmed the situation was not an emergency that would warrant a restraint.
Correction Narrative: After reviewing this event, Blue Skies immediately notified DFPS Hotline as this event was not permitted in Blue Skies Procedure. The staff in question was immediately placed in administrative leave and was terminated. All of Blue Skies staff were retrained in EBI and Blue Skies EBI procedures.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's service plan does not include personal or specific strategies to meet the child's behavioral and supervision needs. It also does not include signatures.
Correction Narrative:
Inspection was completed on 5-3-2024. The case coordinator was interviewed and stated she is working on updating all the service plans to include more details. She pulled up a service plan that she has completed that showed more detail in the level of supervision. We also talked about getting signatures for all the service plans which she had on the update service plan. SA
Email received 04/30/24 Training and feedback has been provided to the Case Coordinator, whom has already made corrections to Service Plans moving forward. These corrections are noted as having more thorough descriptions of supervision and de-escalation techniques that are individualized and specific. After review of this incident, leadership put all staff back through EBI trainings, including the use of the verbal de-escalation processes. Supervisors were retrained on responding to crisis interventions and best practices.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member engaged in a power struggle with a child and pushed the child to the ground.
Correction Narrative:
Inspection was completed on 5-3-2024 at Blue Skies. Staff were interviewed and they stated they have been retrained in EBI and will be getting a refresher for the next couple of weeks. They staff stated they have seen a decrease in restrains the past month and most of the staff are working on their communication. EBI training for the staff was reviewed and the sign in sheet. SA.
Email received 4/30/24 After review of this incident, leadership put all staff back through EBI trainings, including the use of the verbal de-escalation processes. Supervisors were retrained on responding to crisis interventions and best practices.

Deficiency Narrative: A suicide assessment was not administered after a child in care self-harmed.
Correction Narrative: Administrator emailed safety plan and suicide risk assessment to inspector on 12/13/23. A suicide screener was given to child in care on 12/12/23. The child refused to answer the questions. Their refusal is documented. The safety plan states staff will remove potentially dangerous items from room and the child will be in line of sight with wellness checks every 5 minutes.

Deficiency Narrative: The notice must be published at least 10 days before the date of the public hearing. The notice was not published until 7/30/23 for hearing to be held on 8/2/23.
Correction Narrative: Inspector spoke with Ryan Lynn about notifications being sent out in a timely manner. Ryan stated he understood and will comply with minimum standards.

Deficiency Narrative: There were no first aid kits in the operation.
Correction Narrative: At follow up inspection it was verified that the operation had the required first aid kits. Photos were taken.

Deficiency Narrative: A health inspection was not completed.
Correction Narrative: At follow up inspection it was verified that the health inspection had been completed 7/26/23.

Deficiency Narrative: During the first application walk through there was no emergency evacuation plan posted in the building.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up inspection the required emergency and evacuation postings were posted as required. Pictures were taken.
